TopicTitle: Don't try to use the letter "M" in a ship name.

Articles.Content: So i expected things to be janky but i can't even use the letter "M" when naming a ship without going to the tracking center.

So i expected things to be janky but i can't even use the letter "M" when naming a ship without going to the tracking center.  

I don't doubt your experience, but let it be known that I personally named my first ship "# Test Mule x001" and nothing weird is happening, except it's crashing because I designed it wrong. Fly safe.

That's the strangest bug i've heard so far XD
My 'letter issue' today was that I couldn't add a number to my flag title on the Mun, and I think I couldn't add a space after a hyphen either.

Putting this next to other reports of the space center following ships in space, it sounds like the game can get confused about which scene it's rendering. If you're in the VAB but some part of the game still thinks you're in flight, that might explain why 'm' would take you to a map view (which the tracking center essentially is without an active craft). Similarly if you're in high orbit but some part of the game thinks you're at the space center.

I can add to HebaruSan's comment. I ended up seeing the map when trying to search for "Monopropellant" in the VAB part search bar, and whenever I delete a part with the delete key I also activate/deactivate docking controls.

Hi! I've encountered this bug a few times now and it is pretty bad. Whenever I try to name vehicles anything which includes a capital "M", the game opens the map screen even though I am in the VAB. So lets say I wanted to name a vehicle "Mun Explorer". The second I press shift + m the game freezes for a second and I find myself in the map screen without using a vehicle. If I didn't save my creation before naming it, this results in my vehicle not beeing saved. (I do love the VAB though)

KSP2 0.1.0.0.20892   -   Windows 10 Home 21H2   -   Ryzen 9 3950X   -   RTX 2080 Ti (Driver 528.49)

Same here. Also, trying to close map by pressing "m" again, results in this:

The way the inputs always fire makes little sense to me. It'd be nice for you all to make your input system work like basically any modern UI framework does it and add a "handled" argument you can use to consume input so that it isn't fired on multiple events. For example pressing Delete in the VAB changes the docking mode thing (or sometimes the map is opened while typing 'M' into the name of something). This leads me to my next criticism... Why are inputs being processed for actions that can't be taken? If I'm not flying a craft why does that key even do anything? It'd be nice to see this stuff resolved soon as having to have input be set all over the keyboard to counter this just isn't an acceptable option in my opinion.
Another key combo that should be fixed along these similar lines is using Alt+X to reset any trim settings also kills the throttle

Curious. I've got all sorts of craft with names that begin with a capital M, and I'm not seeing this issue at all.

  • Mun Shot III
  • Mun Shot IV
  • Micro CommSat Deployer (you can download this one if you like)
  • Micro Commsat
